videos.headline: Tyus Battle hits a three to give St. John's an early lead over Syracuse
videos.description: 1H (13:22) SYR Tyus Battle made Three Point Jumper. Assisted by John Gillon.

videos.headline: Thompson throws down vicious dunk over St. John's defender
videos.description: Taurean Thompson cuts to the hoop and goes hard with a nasty left-handed dunk right over the defender to cut into Syracuse's deficit.

videos.headline: Tyler Lydon hits a three in transition to help a Syracuse comeback late in the 1st half
videos.description: 1H (3:31) SYR Tyler Lydon made Three Point Jumper. Assisted by John Gillon.

videos.headline: St. John's breaks the 2-3 zone leaving Ahmed for huge slam
videos.description: St. John's makes the quick passes to break down Syracuse's 2-3 zone leaving Bashir Ahmed all alone to destroy the rim with a huge dunk for the Red Storm.

videos.headline: Shamorie Ponds hits his 4th three pointer of the game to extend the Red Storm lead
videos.description: 2H (16:07) SJU Shamorie Ponds made Three Point Jumper. Assisted by Malik Ellison.

videos.headline: A ridiculous run for St. John's includes two dunks and a three point pointer

article.description: Three St. John's players scored in double figures, the Red Storm scored 32 points on 19 Syracuse turnover and the Red Storm overwhelmed its former Big East rival 90-63 Wednesday night.

video.headline: Long distance alley-oop has St. John's rolling
video.caption: St. John's runs the perfect backdoor alley-oop, throwing up the lob to Bashir Ahmed for the huge two-handed slam.
video.description: St. John's runs the perfect backdoor alley-oop, throwing up the lob to Bashir Ahmed for the huge two-handed slam.
video.title: Long distance alley-oop has St. John's rolling

article.headline: St. John's dominates old Big East foe Syracuse

images.name: Long distance alley-oop has St. John's rolling
images.caption: St. John's runs the perfect backdoor alley-oop, throwing up the lob to Bashir Ahmed for the huge two-handed slam.

article.linkText: St. John's dominates old Big East foe Syracuse
article.story:
SYRACUSE, N.Y. -- History was made in the Carrier Dome on Wednesday night.

Syracuse suffered its worst loss in the 36-year history of the Dome, falling to St. John's 93-60.

The defeat marked the first time that a Jim Boeheim-coached team has lost five nonconference games in the regular season -- and Syracuse fans booed their beloved Orange off the court.

Three St. John's players scored in double figures, the Red Storm scored 32 points on 19 Syracuse turnovers and outscored the Orange 36-12 from beyond the arc in overwhelming their former Big East rivals 93-60.

"I didn't get them ready to do what they needed to do. We just didn't execute on defense or offense. St. John's did. That was the game," Boeheim said. "This is on me, not the players."

Syracuse's previous worst loss at the Dome was by 24 points against Seton Hall in 1998.

The win snapped a two-game losing streak and was the third straight for St. John's (6-7) over Syracuse (7-5) in three years.

St. John's coach Chris Mullin was at a loss to explain his team's dominating performance.

"I really can't explain it, especially with the game we're coming off (a 92-76 loss against Penn State). We've been up and down. The one thing about our team is that we're young, we're inexperienced," said Mullin. "When you get effort and energy and share the ball, and do the right things, at some point things will work."

St. John's had only beaten one team with a winning record before the Syracuse victory.

Syracuse shot 33 percent from the field and just 4 of 24 from downtown. St. John's shot 53 percent from the field and hit 12 of 29 3-pointers.

The game was tied at 14 with 12:17 to go in the first half. From that point on, the Red Storm outscored Syracuse 79-46 -- 54-31 in the second half. Syracuse climbed to within six early in the second half on six straight points from Dajuan Coleman, but St. John's answered with six and ran away after that.

Shamorie Ponds led St. John's with 21 points. Bashir Ahmed added 20 points and Malik Ellison 16.

"I had a good feeling we were going to win," said Ponds, who hit four 3-pointers. "We just found holes in the zone and took advantage."

Tyler Lydon, playing with a strained Achilles, had 16 points and 10 rebounds for Syracuse. Coleman had 10 points and 10 rebounds. Taurean Thompson also had 10 points. Andrew White, Syracuse's leading scorer, was held to two points. The starting backcourt of John Gillon and Frank Howard shot a combined 3 of 16.

As far as Boeheim is concerned, the loss may not even be rock-bottom.

"We have a lot of games left, a lot of difficult games. At the rate we're playing right now, we can't win many of those games," he said. "That's what I see."

Ellison scored eight straight points on two 3-pointers and putback to tie the game at 12. The game was tied at 14 when the Red Storm went on a 19-4 run to take a 33-18 lead. The Red Storm hit four consecutive 3-pointers in a span of 1:36 during the run. St. John's held a 39-29 halftime lead.

BIG PICTURE

St. John's: The Red Storm have Syracuse's number, winning three straight.

Syracuse: The Orange continued their disappointing season. The Orange has just one game before the real season -- ACC play -- begins New Year's Day. That probably won't be enough time to turn things around.

UP NEXT

St. John's: Opens Big East play at home next Thursday against No. 13 Butler.

Syracuse: Hosts upstate New York foe Cornell Tuesday in the Orange's last tune-up before ACC play starts on New Year's Day.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.
